alert.note: Alert for Guadalupe; San Miguel (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 01 at 8:38PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in east central New Mexico, Guadalupe. In northeast New Mexico, San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent moderate to heavy rainfall due to slow-moving thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.0 inch are expected over the area through 1000 PM MDT. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tecolote, Los Montoyas, Chapelle and Ojitos Frios. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 325 and 340. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
